intro: Crucianella macrostachya var. penicillata, commonly known as the narrow-leaved sea bean, is a flowering plant belonging to the family Violaceae. It is a small, perennial shrub that typically grows in coastal areas and saline environments. The plant features narrow, elliptical leaves and produces small, violet-colored flowers that bloom in clusters. Its fruits are capsule-like structures that release seeds when mature. This variety is adapted to tolerate salt spray and sandy soils, making it a characteristic species of maritime ecosystems.
